section.p: provides alerting features for monitoring your log data. So-called log metrics support you in checking the severity of your log data. By default, supports the following log metrics:

ul.li: log.warning to count warning messages in your log data.
log.error to count error messages in your log data.
log.fatal to count fatal errors in your log data.
log.critical to count critical errors in your log data.

section.note: Your installation might deviate from this default. The log levels that can be evaluated have been specified during installation of .
section.p: Metrics for log data are handled like any other metrics that are available in . You can use them to define either simple or compound alarms. You can also define notifications that specify how users are informed when a threshold value for the number of warnings or errors is reached or exceeded.
For details on alarms, refer to . For details on notifications, refer to .
